security_audit.summary: This skill is purely documentation containing design system patterns and code examples. All 95 static findings are false positives caused by pattern matching against Markdown formatting (backticks), design token names ($md, $sm, $lg), and metadata fields. No executable code, network access, or security risks present.

content.user_title: Build consistent UI with design system patterns
content.value_statement: Building interfaces without design standards leads to inconsistent styling and maintenance problems. This skill provides component patterns and design tokens for unified, maintainable user interfaces.
actual_capabilities: Apply spacing, color, and typography design tokens
Use core layout components like Box, HStack, and VStack
Build screen layouts with consistent structure
Create accessible form layouts with proper spacing
Implement Button variants for different action types
Avoid anti-patterns like hard-coded values and inline styles
limitations: Provides patterns only, does not generate runnable component code
Does not integrate with specific CSS frameworks automatically
Does not include runtime component library implementation
Requires adaptation to your specific design token values

output_examples.input: Create a list item with avatar, title, and subtitle
output: HStack container with gap $3 and center alignment
Avatar component with size md for consistent sizing
VStack for text with title using $semibold weight
Chevron icon with $textTertiary for subtle indicator
Button with variant solid for primary actions
Size md for standard touch targets
isLoading prop for async state feedback

best_practices: Always use design tokens instead of hard-coded values for colors, spacing, and typography
Import core components from your component library instead of raw platform components
Use semantic color tokens like $textPrimary and $statusError for theme-aware styling
anti_patterns: Hard-coding pixel values or hex colors instead of design tokens
Using raw View and Text from react-native instead of Box and Text from core
Applying inline styles with the style prop instead of token-based props

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for React and React Native component guidance.

faq.question: What design tokens are available?
faq.answer: Spacing tokens $1 through $8, semantic color tokens, and typography tokens from $xs to $2xl.

faq.question: How do I adapt these patterns to my codebase?
faq.answer: Replace the example imports with your component library exports. The token naming and patterns remain the same.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only documentation and patterns. No code is executed and no data is transmitted.

faq.question: Why use design tokens instead of hard-coded values?
faq.answer: Tokens ensure consistent styling, enable theme switching, and make design changes easier to maintain.

faq.question: Does this work with CSS-in-JS libraries?
faq.answer: Yes. The patterns and tokens work with styled-components, Emotion, or any CSS-in-JS approach.
